headline: DeWine urges Ukrainian refugees to come to Ohio
author: Michael Reiner
sentences: “ODJFS is pleased to help bring Ohio’s resettlement agencies, and other charitable organizations together to seek ways of helping displaced Ukrainians,” said ODJFS Director Matt Damschroder.
The summit will help the organizations better understand their possible role in refugee resettlement, and to assess the needs of Ukrainian people.
According to a press release, the Ohio Department of Job and Family Services (ODJFS) will host a summit in Northeast Ohio on Thursday March 17.
COLUMBUS, Ohio (WKBN)- Ohio Governor Mike DeWine plans on welcoming Ukrainian refugees into Ohio.
Involved groups will include resettlement agencies, faith-based organization and charities.
It will bring organizations together that can help relocate Ukrainian families.
The press release does not state where the summit will be held.
